name: df-hcau
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(ccauold, crab(s0, co(chba, cmap, cn), wral(s1, crp, wrex(s2, cn, wral(s3, cfv(cuz, cv(s2)), wbr(cfv(cno, co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cmv, cfv(cv(s0), cv(s3)))), clt, cv(s1)))))))
comment: Define the set of Cauchy sequences on a Hilbert space. See ~ hcau for its membership relation. Note that ` f : NN --> ~H ` is an infinite sequence of vectors, i.e. a mapping from integers to vectors. Definition of Cauchy sequence in [Beran] p. 96. (Contributed by NM, 6-Jun-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)
